page.title: 11THE MAYOR
page.content: Today Mrs. Whiting, the Mayor of Rushcliffe, came to visit us and told us about the work of the Council. She told us about the services that the Council provides for us and how the money that people pay in rates is spent on things for the area. She showed us the Mayoral Chain. It was on a black velvet collar and was very heavy. At the bottom hangs the coat of arms of Rushcliffe. It has a picture of Trent Bridge on it and at the top is a cliff and some rushes. Underneath is the motto, Salus Populi, which means the welfare of the people. Mrs. Whiting told us that she enjoyed visiting different people in the area and found it very interesting. Mrs. Whiting's daughter is the Mayoress.
